By 2014, Bitcoin's development had been captured by a cadre of developers tied to Blockstream, who imposed a 1MB blocksize limit, transforming Bitcoin into a high-fee and low-capacity settlement layer marketed as 'digital gold'. Ver's account reveals how miners, despite their hashpower-based governance role in Satoshi's design, were sidelined through social pressure and DDoS attacks.
